Şahsi olarak Half Life 2 serisinin en sevdiğim oyunu oldu Episode 2. Half Life 2'de hikaye konusunda eksik vardı. Aksiyon hikayeye oranla biraz fazla kaçıyordu, oyuncuyu sıkıyordu. Episode 1'de hikaye fazlaydı aksiyon azdı. Oyun bittiğinde tatmin olamıyordunuz. "Keşke biraz daha fazla combine vursaydım." diyordunuz. Ancak bunda olayı eşitlemişler. Ne aksiyon sıkmıyor, ne de hikaye baymıyor. En iyisi bu olmuş cidden...
Элай...

This is just an expansion for Half-Life 2. Nowadays it'd just be sold as a DLC. I'll paste my review for the base game here, as I feel nothing else really needs to be said about it:
I tried to play this game as a kid, right after beating the first Half-Life and all its expansions. I couldn't do it. I thought the game was a bit boring, and the level design a bit confusing. So at some point, I stopped playing, and moved on.
As an adult, I've now given this game a new try, and I must admit, it was far better than what I remembered it to be. It has a range of very varied and satisfying weapons, a bunch of minigames that aren't too bad, secrets everywhere... It's not incredible, but it's good enough.

Культовая игра, которую проходить не наскучит. Прошел три раза на разных сложностях, доволен. Решил пойти дальше и послушать комментарии разработчиков. Оказалось в разработку этого эпизода пришлось многое изменить, при этом опираясь на комфорт игрока, реалистичность (даже в очень малых вещах типо куртки Аликс) и оптимизацию, за что разработчиков надо поблагодарить. Была поздняя ночь, поэтому решил с комментариями закончить побыстрее, использовал ГМ и иногда Noclip. В итоге оказался в пустоте, где ничего нет ни стен, ни пола, ни частиц выстрелов и гранат после броска, одно лишь небо, бескрайнее небо. Собираюсь заработать все ачивки.
Желаю удачи всем новичкам в прохождении, пока!

A bit of a departure from the rest of the series in many ways. Level design is more focused on large open spaces, but this was in 2007 so "open world" wasn't really a common thing back then. I feel like they tried to do "sidequests" but realized that HL2 inherently has a limited inventory system so the rewards for doing them would have to be minimal at best. 

The section with the Striders is a bit frustrating.
easily the best episode that valve made

Intense gameplay with wave-after-wave style bloons tower defense gameplay.  Shame there weren't many newer ideas but the combat sequences make up for it as I've seen. 
Besides that, the cliffhanger is one of the most intense, edge-of-your seat leave-offs I've ever seen in a game.
Most people already know Half-Life is great, so you don't need my word, but I'll still say for you to play it because I want to.  
:)
